commentBody:
Wesley,

I’m 32, from Minneapolis, white, and I probably wore baggy shorts once or twice, because in the 90’s that’s what was fashionable. I’m sure you may have too. I favor Bernie Sanders over Hillary Clinton, because I’d rather have an idealist who can’t achieve his goals than another politician who’s career has favored large corporations. Is that condescending of me to say? Am I not entitled to that opinion? I’m sure I’ve ironically used the term bro when addressing one of my friends in the last 6 months, but maybe it wasn’t so ironic. I didn’t care for the Jersey Shore mostly because I couldn’t relate to their lifestyle, and I thought they were all pretty awful to each other. In high school I liked underground hip-hop. I’m an artist, and a contributor to the New York Times as well. I consider myself a feminist, I dress on the more effeminate side sometimes, and I try to be as thoughtful with my speech as I can be. Do I still check all the boxes for you? Am I a bro?

The 'First Words' section was until today my favorite part of the NYT magazine. I'd expect more from the editorial board.

Erik
